title: Six arrested in Springfield drug and gun trafficking busts
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Six people were arrested in Springfield, Massachusetts for drug and gun trafficking in coordinated state police operations.
Authorities confiscated 15 handguns, six rifles, 11 large capacity magazines, and hundreds of ammunition rounds.
Police seized 8.5 kg of cocaine, 30,000 bags of fentanyl, and $63,000 in cash during the bust.

title: Dropkick Murphys cut ties with Wasserman agency after CEO’s name appears in Epstein files
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Dropkick Murphys cut ties with Wasserman agency after Casey Wasserman appeared in files linked to Jeffrey Epstein.
Emails between Casey Wasserman and Ghislaine Maxwell were part of documents released by the Department of Justice.
Other artists, including Chappell Roan and Orville Peck, have also left Wasserman agency over the controversy.

title: Video: Water pours into South Station from newly renovated ceiling
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: A sprinkler line was damaged by a worker, causing water to pour into South Station's newly renovated concourse.
The MBTA quickly isolated the leak and completed cleanup by the end of the day without train service disruption.
The incident occurred with a contractor from Hines Development, owner and developer of the new South Station Tower.

title: Did you follow the local news this week? Take our Greater Boston news quiz.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Boston.com offers a quiz to test knowledge of recent news in Greater Boston.
The quiz covers topics such as the Super Bowl, Boston restaurants, and Ben Affleck's connection with Dunkin'.
Peter Chianca, Boston.com's general assignment editor, has been with the site since 2019.

title: MBTA Hingham ferry service canceled for Feb. 13 due to ice in the harbor
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: MBTA cancels Hingham/Hull ferry service for February 13 due to thick ice in Boston Harbor.
Shuttle buses will replace ferry service, starting at Nantasket Beach and ending at Pemberton Point.
Recent winter storm caused thick ice, leading to more frequent ferry cancellations this winter.

title: Retired Gloucester firefighter dies days after being struck by Lowell police cruiser
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Daniel Kennedy, a 60-year-old retired Gloucester firefighter, died after being hit by a Lowell police cruiser at UMass Lowell.
The incident occurred on Wilder Street near the McGauvran Center; the involved officer suffered minor injuries.
An investigation by Middlesex DA's Office and Massachusetts State Police is underway to determine the cause of the crash.

title: 5 players on Red Sox’ roster bubble entering spring training
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Triston Casas may start 2026 with Triple-A Worcester due to health concerns and strong competition for first base.
Kristian Campbell likely returns to minor leagues with defensive issues limiting options despite strong minor league performance.
Pitchers Payton Tolle and Connelly Early expected to begin 2026 in Triple-A due to roster's starting rotation depth.

title: Plans confirmed for new ICE facility in N.H.; documents reveal state officials knew for weeks
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: New Hampshire officials knew of a new ICE facility in Merrimack as early as January, documents confirmed by ACLU reveal.
Confusion around the ICE facility plans in Merrimack led to a New Hampshire commissioner resigning amid calls for transparency.
ICE plans to renovate the Merrimack facility, projected to cost $158 million with a 400-600 bed capacity, by 2026 end.

title: Ex-Patriots coach Dante Scarnecchia isn’t panicking over Will Campbell’s play
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots' coach Mike Vrabel confirms Will Campbell will remain at left tackle despite end-of-season struggles.
Former coach Dante Scarnecchia supports Campbell staying at tackle, citing his strong rookie season before a knee injury.
Ex-Pro Bowl tackle Terron Armstead offers to train Campbell in offseason to address technical issues with his play.

title: Video: Mike Vrabel shares message to distraught Patriots after Super Bowl loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mike Vrabel consoled Patriots players following their Super Bowl LX loss to the Seattle Seahawks with a 29-13 score at Levi's Stadium.
Vrabel emphasized unity and future potential, encouraging players to focus on upcoming opportunities after an unexpectedly successful 2025 season.
Despite the setback, Vrabel highlighted the team's progress from a four-win 2024 season to capturing the AFC East with 14 wins in 2025.
